question: "Rideau Canal", the largest naturally frozen ice rink in the world, is located in which nation?
explanation: Canada houses the Rideau Canal which is the world's largest naturally frozen ice rink. It is 7.8 kilometres long. It is equal to 90 Olympic size skating rinks. It has all amenities and facilities similar to a professional ice rink. It is the longest and largest maintained ice surface on a natural body of water in the world.
